intro: Senecio oodes, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio oodes typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage is usually gray-green with a woolly texture, adding visual interest to gardens.
